channel.title: Problems with vista? Look no futher!
channel.description:
What i noticed about the windows vista is that almost all servers that are manually created do not work. I found out why and how to solve this problem.
1-Make sure you have classpaths(obvious) 2- VERY IMPORTANT!! Since most vista computers have a programs file and a programs file (x86), when running, compiling or using a client there is usually somthing you have to do: Right click the compile or run and click edit Edit all the versions of jdk to your current version ~MAKE SURE YOU CHANGE THE PATH FROM C:\Program Files to C:\Program Files (x86)....... 3- Make sure the compile and run are coded properly 4- If this does not continue to work, the client/server may not be compatible with vista and you may need a differant one =(
Hope this helped =)

item.title: Problems with vista? Look no futher!
item.dc:creator: @spy02468 spy02468
item.description:
@spy02468 wrote:

What i noticed about the windows vista is that almost all servers that are manually created do not work. I found out why and how to solve this problem.

1-Make sure you have classpaths(obvious)
2- VERY IMPORTANT!!
Since most vista computers have a programs file and a programs file (x86), when running, compiling or using a client there is usually somthing you have to do:
Right click the compile or run and click edit
Edit all the versions of jdk to your current version
~MAKE SURE YOU CHANGE THE PATH FROM C:\Program Files to C:\Program Files (x86)â€¦
3- Make sure the compile and run are coded properly
4- If this does not continue to work, the client/server may not be compatible with vista and you may need a differant one =(

Hope this helped =)
